timeline.bodyText: Why is this param named provider in other methods?
timeline.author: YanisBft
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -42,7 +42,7 @@ CLASS net/minecraft/class_918 net/minecraft/client/render/item/ItemRenderer
 		ARG 4 stack
 		ARG 5 light
 		ARG 6 overlay
-	METHOD method_23181 getArmorVertexConsumer (Lnet/minecraft/class_4597;Lnet/minecraft/class_1921;ZZ)Lnet/minecraft/class_4588;
+	METHOD method_23181 getItemGlintConsumer (Lnet/minecraft/class_4597;Lnet/minecraft/class_1921;ZZ)Lnet/minecraft/class_4588;
 		ARG 0 vertexConsumers

replies.bodyText:
Ah, sorry. It wasn't mapped in the other methods and I didn't remember what y'all like to call it.
It's a VertexConsumerProvider which gets shortened to provider in my own projects.
replies.author: Sollace

replies.bodyText:
Changed.
Though someone should maybe watershed these names, since the method to get a VertexConsumer is called getBuffer, it might be sensible to call it something like VertexBuffer or LayerBuffer
replies.author: Sollace

timeline.bodyText: The getters should match the fields which are called GLINT_DIRECT and ENTITY_GLINT_DIRECT, which come from their IDs.
timeline.author: Juuxel

replies.bodyText: Imo mojang used stupid naming there and we should not follow suit.
replies.author: liach

replies.bodyText: What is the verdict? I changed it because the names were not fitting with our naming convention (they're stupid, as liach has said)
replies.author: Sollace

replies.bodyText: Hmm, I'd say renaming is fine if the fields are also renamed to match the methods.
replies.author: Juuxel

replies.bodyText: I agree. Rename field and method
replies.author: Prospector

timeline.message: mapped the item glint layer methods
mapped the item glint layer methods
Rename the fields to match the methods
